metadata.title: CVE-2023-6176 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernel API for thecryptographic algorithm scatterwalk functionality. This issue occurs when auser constructs a malicious packet with specific socket configuration,which could allow a local user to crash the system or escalate theirprivileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.15.0-94.104
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1004-kvm - 5.15.0-1050.55
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1006-azure - 5.15.0-1055.63
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1055.63
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1050.58
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1046.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency - 5.15.0-94.104
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-94.104
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1025-oem - 6.1.0-1025.25
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.15.0-94.104').
